snippet: A shift in the way companies deduct stock options will raise reported net earnings, but it could also rekindle a debate about low U.S. corporate taxes....
abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column holds Financial Accounting Standards Board's new auditing rule, which forces companies to give stock options tax benefit more prominent placement in reports, will reignite debate on how little American corporations actually pay in taxes compared to individuals; notes shift offers other benefits to companies and investors, but is expected to renew criticism about fairness of tax system.
lead_paragraph: A shift in the way companies deduct stock options will raise reported net earnings, but it could also rekindle a debate about low U.S. corporate taxes.

headline.print_headline: More Profit, More Clarity on Taxation
headline.main: A Profit Bump for Companies, and Tax Transparency for Investors
